Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the AKS cluster, including compute capacity, scalability, and workload types. Identify the applications and services that will run on the cluster.
Design the architecture for the AKS cluster, including node pools, VM sizes, and integration with other Azure services. Plan for high availability and disaster recovery.
Secure approvals and authorizations for the AKS deployment, including budget, compliance, and security reviews.
Create the AKS cluster in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Configure node pools, VM sizes, and Kubernetes versions.
Set up networking for the AKS cluster, including virtual networks, subnets, and network security groups. Configure ingress and egress traffic rules.
Enable security features such as Azure Active Directory integration, role-based access control (RBAC), and pod security policies. Configure encryption for data at rest and in transit.
Deploy containerized applications to the AKS cluster using Kubernetes manifests or Helm charts. Ensure proper resource allocation and scaling configurations.
Set up monitoring and alerting for the AKS cluster using Azure Monitor and Kubernetes tools. Configure alerts for node health, pod performance, and resource utilization.
Set up backup solutions for AKS workloads and configure disaster recovery plans. Test failover scenarios to ensure resiliency.
Perform thorough testing of the AKS cluster, including load testing, failover scenarios, and resource scaling. Validate that the cluster meets performance requirements.
Document the AKS cluster setup, including architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Share documentation with the operations team.
Provide training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the AKS cluster. Include best practices for Kubernetes management.
Verify that the AKS cluster meets regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to ensure security and operational standards.
